original: Lindwall, Martin Tore, skådespelare, Göteborg, f. 10/11/00 i Sundsvall av prov:läk. Anders L. o. Maria Fürst. G. m. Signe Elisabet Morell. Barn: Kerstin Ehsabet f. 33. — Stud:ex. 19, Dramat, teat. elevsk. 21-23. Prem:-elev 23 o. eng. v. teat. 24-27, v. Lorens-bergsteat. i Gbg 27-34 o. däreft. v. Stadsteat. där. Bl. roller: Arnold Mes-senius d. y. i Messeniernas fall, Paul Mercier i Fröken Pascal, Mauritz i Dunungen (samti. på Dramat, teat.), titelroll, i Don Carlos, Franzi i I utkanten, Fedor Fedorow i Rost, Li-sardo i Järnvattnet i Madrid, Lill-Klas i Stor-Klas o. Lillklas, Larsson i Melodien som kom bort, Mia i Winterset, Cello i Kvartetten som ’sprängdes, Svedje i Rid i natt. Orestes i Flugorna. Ofta uppläsare av lyrik i radio. Ordf. i Sv. teaterfönb. fackorg. i Gbg. v. ordensgen. i Moderlogen av T. S. O.
translated: Lindwall, Martin Tore, actor, Gothenburg, born on November 10, 1900 in Sundsvall to medical doctor Anders L. and Maria Fürst. Married to Signe Elisabet Morell. Children: Kerstin Elisabet, born in 1933. Graduated from high school in 1919. Studied drama at the theater school from 1921 to 1923. Became a trainee in 1923 and worked as an English-speaking actor at the theater from 1924 to 1927, then at Lorensbergsteatern in Gothenburg from 1927 to 1934, and thereafter at the City Theater. Notable roles include Arnold Messenius Jr. in "The Fall of the Messenians," Paul Mercier in "Miss Pascal," Mauritz in "The Duckling" (also performed at the theater school), the title role in "Don Carlos," Franzi in "On the Outskirts," Fedor Fedorow in "Rust," Lisardo in "The Iron Water in Madrid," Lill-Klas in "Big-Klas and Little-Klas," Larsson in "The Lost Melody," Mia in "Winterset," Cello in "The Quartet That Exploded," and Svedje in "Ride Tonight." Also frequently worked as a poetry reader on the radio. Chairman of the Swedish Theater Association and a member of the Swedish Order of Freemasons.
